channel.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
channel.description:
This is a lame terminal-based BlackJack game in C... don't expect pretty code. It should be cross-platform, but I've only tested in *NIX environments since that's the only OS family I develop on.
https://github.com/t4/blackj
Tell me what you think.

item.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

i’ve started on my poke game and am scrapping this. the poker game is going much better since i’ve talked to super_ about certain C concepts. i also heeded s1gma’s advice on using fgets. i plan to post it when i’m done.

Read full topic

item.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Nah, it’s always face cards are 10. Thats kinda the whole point of blackjack, or else your only combo would be J/A 10

Read full topic

item.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:11, topic:447515”][quote author=Method link=topic=550409.msg4035712#msg4035712 date=1341184067]
Also, are you treating face cards equally (with value 10)? What about aces counting for either 1 or 11?
[/quote]
i didn’t bother with ace high/low. i was under the impression face cards are J 11, Q 12, K 13[/quote]
I haven’t played a game of blackjack where that was the case, but it could be one of the variants.

Read full topic

item.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Method:

Shouldn’t a card have a suit and a rank, not a color and a suit (nearly the same thing)?

yeah, you’re right - i named them incorrectly

item.title: BlackJack in C (warning: ugly)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:5, topic:447515”]char command[command_len]; ... scanf("%s", command);
lol rly

after 1 play:

==1937== ==1937== HEAP SUMMARY: ==1937== in use at exit: 416 bytes in 2 blocks ==1937== total heap usage: 316 allocs, 314 frees, 2,496 bytes allocated ==1937== ==1937== LEAK SUMMARY: ==1937== definitely lost: 416 bytes in 2 blocks ==1937== indirectly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks ==1937== possibly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks ==1937== still reachable: 0 bytes in 0 blocks ==1937== suppressed: 0 bytes in 0 blocks ==1937== Rerun with --leak-check=full to see details of leaked memory ==1937== ==1937== For counts of detected and suppressed errors, rerun with: -v ==1937== Use --track-origins=yes to see where uninitialised values come from ==1937== ERROR SUMMARY: 3 errors from 3 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)

~_~ bad[/quote]
whoopsies. ps, didn’t valgrind it.

total heap usage: 316 allocs, 314 frees, 2,496 bytes allocated

that’s not too bad, though

Read full topic
